psalm.text:
[[Ps 102,16]]The nations shall revere your name, O LORD, 
and all the kings of the earth your glory,
[[Ps 102,17]]when the LORD has rebuilt Zion 
and appeared in his glory;
[[Ps 102,18]]when he has regarded the prayer of the destitute, 
and not despised their prayer.

[[Ps 102,19]]Let this be written for the generation to come, 
and let his future creatures praise the LORD:
[[Ps 102,20]]"The LORD looked down from his holy height, 
from heaven he beheld the earth,
[[Ps 102,21]]to hear the groaning of the prisoners, 
to release those doomed to die."

[[Ps 102,29]]The children of your servants shall abide, 
and their posterity shall continue in your presence,
[[Ps 102,22]]that the name of the LORD may be declared on Zion; 
and his praise, in Jerusalem,
[[Ps 102,23]]when the peoples gather together 
and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Mt 15,1]]Some Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem and said,
[[Mt 15,2]]Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? They do not wash (their) hands when they eat a meal.
[[Mt 15,10]]He summoned the crowd and said to them, "Hear and understand.
[[Mt 15,11]]It is not what enters one's mouth that defiles that person; but what comes out of the mouth is what defiles one."
[[Mt 15,12]]Then his disciples approached and said to him, "Do you know that the Pharisees took offense when they heard what you said?"
[[Mt 15,13]]He said in reply, "Every plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.
[[Mt 15,14]]Let them alone; they are blind guides (of the blind). If a blind person leads a blind person, both will fall into a pit."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

first_reading.text:
[[Jr 30,1]]The following message came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
[[Jr 30,2]]Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Write all the words I have spoken to you in a book.
[[Jr 30,12]]For thus says the LORD: Incurable is your wound, grievous your bruise;
[[Jr 30,13]]There is none to plead your cause, no remedy for your running sore, no healing for you.
[[Jr 30,14]]All your lovers have forgotten you, they do not seek you. I struck you as an enemy would strike, punished you cruelly;
[[Jr 30,15]]Why cry out over your wound? your pain is without relief. Because of your great guilt, your numerous sins, I have done this to you.
[[Jr 30,18]]Thus says the LORD: See! I will restore the tents of Jacob, his dwellings I will pity; City shall be rebuilt upon hill, and palace restored as it was.
[[Jr 30,19]]From them will resound songs of praise, the laughter of happy men. I will make them not few, but many; they will not be tiny, for I will glorify them.
[[Jr 30,20]]His sons shall be as of old, his assembly before me shall stand firm; I will punish all his oppressors.
[[Jr 30,21]]His leader shall be one of his own, and his rulers shall come from his kin. When I summon him, he shall approach me; how else should one take the deadly risk of approaching me? says the LORD.
[[Jr 30,22]]You shall be my people, and I will be your God.
first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah
